text: Lowell A. Reed Jr. (June 21, 1930 â€“ April 11, 2020) was an American politician and lawyer. He was a United States District Judge of the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania from 1988 to 1999. He was nominated by President Ronald Reagan. Reed Jr. was born in West Chester, Pennsylvania. Reed Jr. died on April 11, 2020 in Jenkintown, Pennsylvania of Parkinson's disease-related problems, aged 89. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Lawyers from Pennsylvania Category:American judges Category:Politicians from Pennsylvania Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Lowell A. Reed Jr.
